item.title: [IPL-10410] Adjust MT940 parser for TC/AUT banking
item.description:
0) Adjust generation of MT104 sender's/transaction reference
The purpose provided by us in the MT104 outgoing files and parsed from the MT940 input files is not usable in a unique way across all MT940 message types. Therefore we will use the MT104 sender's/transaction reference currently provided in fields :20: / :21: / :21E: / :21D:

Example:

{-
COBADEFFXXX
COBAATWXXXX
104
:20:TC20130327/1
:23E:RFDD
:21E:TC20130327/1
:30:130326
:50K:/311301006302EUR
Billpay GmbH
Zinnowitzer Str. 1
D-10115 Berlin
:52A:COBAATWXXXX
:71A:SHA
:21:TC20130327/1
:23E:OTHR/TYPE/01
:21D:TC20130327/1
:32B:EUR18,03
:57C://AT53548
:59:/AT961400002110079497
Anita Hörhann
Skraupstraße 24/30/20 
1210 Wien
:70:BP/0001913896
conrad.at 1943902104
1. VON 24 RATEN
KUNDENSERVICE BILLPAY 5574 2091055
-}

TODO: Change the generated reference from TC20130327/1 to 

 SELECT 'DID' || lpad(('1234567')::text, 10, '0') - example: "DID0001234567"

where 1234567 is the subdebt ID. The sender's/transaction reference seems to appear most reliably in the MT940 messages and can thus be used to match the transaction.

To allow for automated payment processing for TC/AUT, the MT940 parser must be adjusted to parse 3 different types of bank transactions:

1) MT940 Direct Debit Notes

GV Code 071 (LASTSCHRIFTEINREICHUNG)

Example:

:61:1303280326C25,58NCHKDID0001234567//VIE201893733
RC245201303260011717
:86:071?00LASTSCHRIFTEINREICHUNG?1099299?20/VWZ:BP/0001892833 ?21conr
ad.at 1943860519 1. VON?2224 RATEN KUNDENSERVICE ?23BILLPAY 5574 
2091055/FBB:EU?24R25,58/FBA:NET-M PRIVATBANK?251891 AG/FUR:VIE201
893733?3100438027750?32B rgler Erwin?340

DID0001234567 corresponds to the reference provided in the initial MT104 message where 1234567 is in this example the subdebt ID.

TODO:

  • Parse subdebt ID in field :61:
  • From the subdebt ID create an entry in the load queue table. In column dtlq_purpose must be provided the TC purpose generated from the subdebt ID: BP/0001234567 (always left padded with zeros to a unique length of 10 and prefixed by "BP/"). That way the transaction can will processed automatically by the load queue.

2) MT940 Returning debits

GV Code 009 (RETOURENHUELLE LASTSCHRIFT)

The messages of this type can have different formats. Therefore the parser must be more flexible.

Example 1 "NORMAL REFERENCE / UNKNOWN BANK PURPOSE":

:61:1303260326D59,36NRTIDID0001234567//VIE201893735
RC249201303260011716
:86:009?00RETOURENHUELLE LASTSCHRIFT?1099199?20/VWZ:UNKNOWN BANK OR ?
21ACCOUNT BP/0001889425 ?22conrad.at 1943856627 1. VON?2312 RATEN
 FBB:EUR59,36/FAG:N?24ET-M PRIVATBANK 1891 ?25AG/FUR:VIE201893735
?3119602015242?32NET-M PRIVATBANK 1891 AG?340

-> Parse subdebt ID from field :61:, create the purpose (see 1)) and store it in dtlq_purpose.

Example 2 "NORMAL REFERENCE / CORRUPTED PURPOSE":

:61:1303260327D31,15NRTIDID0001234567//VIE201900724
RC249201303270006107
:86:009?00RETOURENHUELLE LASTSCHRIFT?1099199?20/VWZ:00 DID0001234567 6
 ?21conrad.at 1943255 983 2. VO?22ORA:26.15 CHG:5.00 Nichte ?23in
losung/Nichtannahme ?24BP/000159578N 18 RATEN ?25KUNDENSERVICE BI
LLPAY/FBB:E?26UR31,15/FAG:NET-M ?27PRIVATBANK 1891 ?28AG/FAG:ODEO
NSPLATZ ?2918/FUR:VIE201900724?311321504?32friedrich k lbl?33Herm
ann-L ns-Gasse 26?340

-> Parse subdebt ID from field :61:, create the purpose (see 1)) and store it in dtlq_purpose.

Example 3 "NONREF REFERENCE / PURPOSE OK"

:61:1303290328D57,23NRTINONREF//VIE201909346
RC249201303280005520
:86:009?00RETOURENHUELLE LASTSCHRIFT?1099199?20/VWZ:00 DID0001234567 3
 ?21conrad.at 1943294 886 2. VO?22ORA:51.23 CHG:6.00 Nichte ?23in
losung/Nichtannahme ?24BP/000161432N 9 RATEN ?25KUNDENSERVICE BIL
LPAY ?265/FBB:EUR57,23/FAG:NET-M ?27PRIVATBANK 1891 ?28AG/FAG:ODE
ONSPLATZ ?2918/FUR:VIE201909346?3187502?32Robert Klien?33Dr.-Anto
n-Schneider-Stra e?340

-> Field :61: indicates NONREF. Parse subdebt ID from VWZ.

3) Remaining transactions

Parse transactions that don't match one of the above criteria and store them in the load queue for manual matching.

TODOs

  • parse 3 types of tramsaction via MT940 parser
  • prepare / store parsed data in the load queue
  • create Unit tests
item.summary: Adjust MT940 parser for TC/AUT banking

comments.comment: @Wieslaw: could you please estimate roughly what the adjustments would mean in hours. For customer reimbursements we don't know the format yet but I assume if looks similar to 3).
well ... since yesterday, we also have the correct purpose !

that's good news! We also get the bank account number (but not the sort code) and the in some cases the account holder.

Let's wait for the bank transfer tomorrow to check if the format/provided information is fine there, too.

Daniel, could you afterwards pls clarify with BVW/Coba that this is the final format. That information must then be 100% reliable.
Stefan to clarify how DID work with the dunnings

item.title: [IPL-10247] Increasing order values for all payment methods
item.description:
Introduction

Around 40% of the heizoel24.de (oil delivery) merchants need to increase the order value (TC) after shipping their goods. So therefore you have to adapt our accept/deny logic for ED and PC requests.(for all payment methods)

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
We check customer limit for PC and ED requests We have to use new formula for PC and ED requests

We want to change the logic for accepting/denying PC and ED requests for all payment methods. Therefore we have to provide new fields in the BO, where parameters for this new formula can be provided.
This values will provided in the localized portal settings. So we have to extent table ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_localized (the settings are portal/country/currency dependant) with new colums "mrcl_increase_tolerance_percentage" (numeric(2,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00) and "mrcl_increase_tolerance_amount" (in cents - integer NOT NULL DEFAULT 0).

Anytime we receive an ED or PC request, that will increase the order amount, instead of doing a customer limit check (status quo), we use a new formula (see below) and payment method dependant logic (see table below) to determine if the increase is allowed or not.

Payment method dependant logic:

PM IS SHOULD BE
TC no increase of the order amount is allowed at all For TC orders we allow an increase via ED or PC as long as the due date of the first rate is not reached. After the due date of the first rate, we don't allow a increase.
DD we allow an increase until the debit is charged for the first time. We do this based on the result of proc get_maximum_customer_amount Only allow an increase until we charge the direct debit for the first time. If the debit was not charged so far, use the above formular to check if the increase is allowed
INV We allow an increase all the time based on the result of proc get_maximum_customer_amount Allow an increase always based on the result of the new formular

Note: Increasing the amount for an unactivated order is possible as long as the formula holds.

New formula:

2 new Parameters:
1. Tolerance% (T%) "mrc_tolerance_percentage"
2. Tolerance Amount (TA) "mrc_tolerance_amount" Note: (in requested currency)

OVAC = order value after capture
OVAI = order value after increase

IF OVAI <= OVAC*(100% + T%) OR OVAI <= OVAC + TA THEN 
    accept increase request
ELSE
    decline increase request
END IF

Note 1: All occurences of proc get_maximum_customer_amount in PC and ED requests should be replaced.
Note 2: Functions to adjust are mainly ipaylater_customer.edit_cart_content (invoked only via API) and ipaylater_customer.partial_cancel_order (invoked via API and BO).

Important: Always consider the original order value at capture time! (so the merchant can not do a endless loop and increase after each iteration)

Hint: the capture amount can be retrived from table customer_order_modification, column=com_order_current_total, com_type='CA'.

Note: Default values are 0% and 25Euro / XCHF: 0% and 25 CHF (clarified with Matthias).

TODO
  • create new colums in merchant_configuration_localized table
  • adjust BO view
  • implement default values for portal creation
  • implement PM dependent logic
  • implement new formula
  • check if rate plan is re calculated correctly for increase of the amount
  • create regression tests
item.summary: Increasing order values for all payment methods

comments.comment: Esprit as well.
This includes PC and ED operations.

TODO Joachim: was ist der Ausfall bei Heizöl? Welche Formel soll angewendet werden? Was ist der Default Wert?

Mögl. Lösung: X%ige Erhöhung vom Originalwert pro Portal zulassen
Einschränkung auf vor Einzug der ersten Rate.
@Joachim: bitte auf Fragen oben antworten.

Wo oben? Kommentiert hatte ich im Originalfeld schon.
Gruss
Joachim

item.title: [IPL-10127] shopping portal CSV Reports Anpassungen
item.description:
IST-Prozess:

Die Hanseatic schickt uns nicht wie vereinbart alle csv reports.
Folglich lagen bis dato nicht alle reports vor.

Soll-Prozess:

Anpassung der Reports:

Report 1 accepted:
Drei Instanzen beim FTP-Server abgelegt
1.EVOLAN historisch: alle relevanten Konten bis zum Ende von Evolan
-> billpayEV_accepted_2013_02_04...
2. KORDOBA historisch: alle relevanten Konten bis einschl. 01.02.2013
-> billpayC24_accepted_2013-02-04
3. billpayC24_accepted_2013-XX-XX

Report 2 revenue:
1.EVOLAN historisch: alle relevanten Transaktionen bis einschl. 29.01.2013
-> billpayEV_ges_revenue_2013-02-04
2. EVOLAN Report von gestern mit allen relevanten Konten vom 30.01. - 01.02.13
-> billpayEV_accepted_2013-02-04
3. ab heute wird jeweils Mo.-Fr. um 16.00 Uhr ein EVOLAN-Report mit den Daten
von jeweils gestern abgelegt
-> billpayEV_revenue_2013-XX-XX
4. KORDOBA historisch: alle bisherigen Buchungen bis einschl. 31.01.2013
-> billpayC2_revenue_2013-02-04
5. KORDOBA aktuell: Report von gestern mit Buchungen vom 01.02.2013
6. ab heute wird jeweils Mo.-Fr. um 16.00 Uhr ein KORDOBA-Report mit den Daten
von jeweils gestern abgelegt
-> billpayC24_revenue_2013-XX-XX

Report 3 canceled:
1. EVOLAN -> billpay_cancelled
2. KORDOBA -> billpayC24_cancelled

Report 4 update:verbleibt erstmal wie er ist aus EVOLAN, im Laufe des Monats wird hier ein Report aus KORDOBA zu generiert.

Report 5 declined: da die Daten grds. aus ORCA kommen, gibt es im Grunde keine Änderung. Report wird täglich automatisch auf dem Server bereitgestellt.

Report 6 pre-accepted:da die Daten grds. aus ORCA kommen, gibt es im Grunde keine Änderung. Report wird täglich automatisch auf dem Server bereitgestellt.

comments.comment: @Sepi: the import seems to work technically. Can you please check with Jan if the imported data is correct.
Yes, I can do that. But therefor it needs to be live, isn't it? And this is actually not the case, right?
No, it's not live. The idea is to test it and if it works correctly to put it live then. You can test with Jan on his local machine.
There are still some missing date. I need to talk with hanseatic to find out what the problem is.

item.title: [IPL-10082] DE - Create definition files for the data model (decision engine)
item.description:
Introduction

We have to update the decision engine (VATRA) data model.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No-Status-Quo A recent version of our data model in the RiskSuite

We have to manually adjust an xml schema (billpay_request_response.xsd) that defines the valid structure of the input data for the decision engine. Moreover we need to manually adjust two xslt files (billpay-request.xsl and billpay-response.xsl) that map the data from the XML request to the internal format.

Just use the attached xsd and convert/adapt it to the recent data model. Do the "same" adaption (based on the attached example) with the xsl files. On one (or two) days, we will send these files to SHS and get a valdidation/confirmation back. Possible we need several iterations to provide proper files.

The attached xsd and xslt files should be used as a starting point and extended according to the input/output model created in the DE. They should be commited to the SVN.

Input and output model are defined in the decision engine:

http://192.168.3.148:8080/guardean/
user: billpay
pwd: billpay

-> Files/Datamodel/input_model
-> Files/Datamodel/output_model

After the files are adjusted they must be deployed on the DE server (see VaTra_Installation_Guide.docx for details).

TODO
  • adjust xsd
  • adjust xslt files
  • deploy files on the DE server (done by SHS)
  • test if update was succesful
item.summary: DE - Create definition files for the data model (decision engine)

comments.comment:
Sample for creating of xsd for mapping arrays:

<xsd:sequence>
<xsd:element name="Position" type="PositionType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded">
<xsd:annotation>
<xsd:documentation>order position element</xsd:documentation>
</xsd:annotation>
</xsd:element>
</xsd:sequence>
Knowledge about creation of nested complex types in XSD required.

item.title: [IPL-10079] DE - Create Unittest for regression testing of the DE Webservice
item.description:
Introduction

We want to do a unit test-regression test based on csv-files to compare expected results from the Decision Engine.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No- Status-Quo Decision Engine results compared with excepted values

We need a unit test the consumes a CSV file created by the Risk team. Each row in the CSV file represents a test case that needs to be executed against the DE. The result of the DE is compared with another CSV file that contains the expected output data. One row in the expected CSV file represents the output data from a single DE service request.

-> The number of rows in the input and expected CSV file must be equal!

The input and output data of the DE is hierarchical. Therefore the data for each test case has to be flattened to fit in one row of the CSV file. Data for arrays with dynamical length will be provided column wise. That means the number of elements in each array must be restricted.

Within the flattened CSV files will defined the object path in the header that will be used by a generic parser to build the DecisionEngineRequestDTO/DecisionEngineResponseDTO instances (see attached example). That way extending the data model will not require to adjust the parser.

To compare the result with the expected result, the OBJECT_PATH instruction will be used to retrieve the result values from the DecisionEngineResponseDTO instance and to compare the retrieved result value with the expected value from the CSV.

Hint: A java sample program for how the OBJECT_PATH instruction can be used to populate the DTO instances is attached (ReflectionTest.java).

The goal is that the input and output data model (+including changes to the request and response DTOs) can be extended without any change of the parser!

A jUnit test class needs to be created and added to the Merchant Service project. The unit test should be deployed in a new project on Jenkins. Every night or on demand will be checked if tests are passing. IT and Risk will be notified when the test fails. Logic is described in the image below.

Note:

  • Ignore columns in the CSV where the value for OBJECT_PATH is empty
  • Ingore header rows 2 and 3 (not to be parsed)

How does the unit test work?

1. Risk provides CSV input and CSV expected data (one row per testcase)

For each row in the input file:
2. Extract input data and map to DecisionEngineRequestDTO object
3. With DecisionEngineRequestDTO object do a Decision Engine request
4. Receive the DecisionEngineResponseDTO object
5. Load expected data from row in the expected CSV file
6. Create a comperator that compares actual output with expected data
7. Compareator provide result of comparision
8. Jenkins evaluate result/ make some actions

TODO
  • concept for mapping enums
  • implement logic in the Merchant Service project
  • create Jenkins project and deploy tests
  • alert e-mail will go to it@ and risk@
item.summary: DE - Create Unittest for regression testing of the DE Webservice

item.title: [IPL-10074] DE - Create webservice client to communicate with DE
item.description:
Introduction

This story is aboubt creating a webservice client to communicate with the decision engine webservice/communication layer (VATRA)

This ticket depends on IPL-10082.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No-Status-Quo Have a working Java webservice client to communicte with the decision engine

In IPL-10082 were created the necessary definition files for the data model that is used in the decision engine and all files that map the request XML to a representation used within the decision engine and that map the result data of the decision engine to a response XML. These files were deployed on the DE server.

In this user story we will create the Java client class that can be used to create a request to the DE. The client will handle all data serialization from Java objects to XML / de-serialization from XML to Java objects.

  • Generate generic webservice client using CXF (see sample code in comment) from a WSDL file. Find out how the request struct must be created. Map generic input/output data to Java objects.
  • WSDL/XSD files can be found under: T:\projekte\decision engine\install\20121011_guardean_RiskSuite\services\svc_workflow\interface\wsdl
  • See attached document (WorkflowServiceGuide.pdf) on how to use the workflow engine web service interface.
  • Webservice Endpoint: http://192.168.3.148:8080/workflow/services/WorkflowEngine2

Input and output model are defined in the decision engine:

http://192.168.3.148:8080/guardean/
user: billpay
pwd: billpay

-> Files/Datamodel/input_model
-> Files/Datamodel/output_model

TODO
  • create webservice client
  • map input/output data from/to output data
  • use PrevalidationStateView to map pre_state and post_state
item.summary: DE - Create webservice client to communicate with DE

item.title: [IPL-9079] Customizable templates for all UMS emails
item.description:
IS:
For all email types that can configured via the notification tab in the backoffice we can provide custom UMS IDs in the Backoffice. When this is done the custom UMS template associated with the UMS ID is used instead of the default template. For all other email templates (e.g. cancellation, partial cancellation, returning DD, etc.) we cannot provide customized templates.

Some additional emails were customized for Esprit by making a static redirect in ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang.

SHOULD BE:
All email templates for all countries and payment methods should be customizable. It is enough when the email templates that can not be configured using the notifications tab in the BO can be configured by manually creating a entry in some configuration table in the BO.

The hard coded redirects for Esprit in proc ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang should be removed and replaced by the respective config entries in the DB.\

How this will implemented:

  • Remove the custom ums id from notification types pages.
  • Create new ums mapping table, which will map directly to interface type. (ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_custom_ums_id)
    with business key:
    portal_id, country, currency, payment-method, customer_group,
    and attributes:
    interface id, custom ums id
  • Populate hard coded ums ids to the new mapping table. (The hard coded config is in ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang function).
  • Adjust ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang that it will use the new mapping table. If a key for a given interface type does not exist in mapping table
    then use the default ums_id.
  • Insert the old mappings existing in DB. an put them to the new table. (Should be possible with a simple script)
    Drop the mapping table.
  • Drop old mapping table, which mapped interface type to notification type.
  • In this user story is not contained any configuration via Backoffice. Instead new redirects can only be added on request by the IT team.
item.summary: Customizable templates for all UMS emails

item.title: [IPL-687] Zertifizierung des Oxid-Plugins
item.description:
Um die Zertifizierung durchführen zu können, muss eine virtuelle Testumgebung aufgesetzt werden. In dieser Testumgebung müssen dann mitgelieferte Testsequenzen gegen das zu zertifizierende Modul ausgeführt werden. Die Ergebnisse des Tests werden in den Zertifizierungsantrag eingetragen und an Oxid geschickt.

Muss aufgrund des doch recht großen Aufwands eingeplant werden.

http://www.oxid-esales.com/de/exchange
http://wiki.oxidforge.org/Certification/Modules
http://wiki.oxidforge.org/Downloads/VMware

comments.comment: Dirk ist im Gespräch mikt Herr Steiner von Oxid, könnten auf den Marktplatz kommen, wennn wir zertifiziert sind, könnten damit Leads generieren.

Hallo Jan,


   Preparing the certification/developing environment:

    - install virtual machine (8h)
    - install oxid shop on the new virtual machine base on certification specification (2h + 1h specific version )
      ( Deepens also what version do we want to get certification. if we want certification for more versions then we need to install every specific version
        More versions means also that our plugin code need to meet specific versions characteristics )
    - Run Oxid shop tests (3h)
    - Install Test Module (6h)
    - Run Test Module (2h)
    - Install our module and run test (1h)
    - Interpret results for the fist time (2h)

   Billpay module code review

    - Split large functions (8h+)
      (also do test driven development spiting the functions and writing the tests)
    - Write getter and setter function for all global classes proprieties
    - Check and replace PHP super global usages (1h)
    - Remove logic from templates files (6h)
    - Check oxSuperCfg and oxExceptions (2h)
    - oxBlogs in templates (2h)
    - Databases access slave mater (2h)
    - Inter-modular compatibility (3h)
    - Documentation (6h)
 
    * Run Module tests and interpret results
    ( done after changes are done to the plugin )

    Write unit test

    - write unit test for all remaining functions
    - run interpret test

Thank you and if there are questions please let me know

All the best
Catalin
Sum = 57h

item.title: [IPL-10608] Review issues bugs
item.description:
• test request -> 2 open debts (preauth) we need to stay consitent (modify decision engine off-line service)
  • new vs completly new (this is correct) - check if there is a correct name for the enum (should be ok)
  • payment history doesn't work? (trunk; customer?) - check loaded payment history for customer
  • index rating provider history is not correct (0-> 1) - the array should start from index "1" not zero
  • transaction sysnc -> not deleting - hash value, the request synchornization does not work
  • score value approved -> wrong? - (it is set by the offline order service, for mock value it could be ok)
  • score day_of_week -> string? - (it should ba string, check if its returned right day for all fields, It was seen that oncec is 2nd day once 3rd day)
  • score value Deltavista - (Use the mock value for the deltavista version 2. - default Deltavista (DV version 2)
  • order detail (net/gross) mixed up, (netto value is presendted in order detail, it should be the order total wroth, only for TC and totalOrderValue and orderValue is diffrent)
  • data type string and text are mixed up. (Check if the fields are the same like in the documentation)
  • rating provider_strategy -> where is this coming from? (I'ts coming from the mock, so this should be ok) @wieslaw it comes from the mock
  • device fingerprint -> tests missing
  • risk levels are note existing (TC) - Risk levels are not existing for payment method 2-3. Results of the risk levels are wrong, there should be amount.
  • cancel orders has also be provided in order hsitory (to recheck, it's probably ok)
  • rating provider -> global setting -> are missing - no global settings are set.
  • why does deviating shipping adress check is not working? - (in the mapping class the check for diviating adress did not work, so the flag isdeviating adress was true, where it should not)
  • workflowname is corrupt - (workflow name "ASD" ) this is invalid it works @wieslaw
  • approved -> customer validation result -> check text? (There is APPROVED text in customer validation results table, somewhere the requirements changed).
  • rating provider processing time is not store (for now we store the deltavita processing time as '00:00:00', this is not fixable for now. For remembering .@wieslaw this works as expected to decide what to do in the future.

Dunnig Fee per debt

  • proper exception message is missing

Note: Update script for Bürgel etc. has to be rerun when we to the total roll-out.

item.title: [IPL-10614] CSV inkasso import not working anymore
item.description:
since 01.03.2012, our inkasso CSV importer stopped for every inkasso partner for daily + monthly updates. export works.

seems related to factoring ...

csv_batch_log does not throw any error - just says ok every day
item.summary: CSV inkasso import not working anymore

comments.comment: Requires a hot fix.
also the alerting must be fixed. Why didn't we see an error in the log file?

item.title: [IPL-10607] Customer Received Wrong Partial Payment Confirmation Email (Invoice instead of Transaction Credit)
item.description:
The customer in the following email, has received a partial payment confirmation email for invoice, although she is paying via transaction credit.
This is probably cause somehow buy our new allocation algorithm for TC DEU.
A partial payment confirmation for TC DEU was not specified yet, but isntead will be covered later in a follow up ticket.
Please, check what happened here and make sure, the customer does not received this email, if he is paying via transaction credit.
.
This Is Esprit TC DEU (maybe it is a unique bug.)
.
.

Hi Duc,

was ist denn hier passiert?
- Zahlungsziel in der Vergangenheit machen wir ja öfter, ist nichts neues
- keine Bankverbindung, obwohl der Kunde überweisen soll
- warum soll der Kunde 194,44 EUR überweisen?

Danke und Gruß
Holger




-------- Original-Nachricht --------
Betreff: 	Aw: Teilzahlung eingegangen
Datum: 	Wed, 3 Apr 2013 14:43:10 +0200
Von: 	Simone Ewald <simoneewald@web.de>
An: 	'Bounce Recipient' <service@billpay.de>


Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren,
 
es handelt sich um Ratenzahlung. Wie kann dann der Restbetrag auf einmal fällig sein und dann dazu noch zu einem Datum, dass bereits vergangen ist?
 
Gesendet: Mittwoch, 03. April 2013 um 09:19 Uhr
Von: "Billpay Service Mails" <service@info.billpay.de>
An: simoneewald@web.de
Betreff: Teilzahlung eingegangen
esprit.de Billpay
 

Sehr geehrte(r) Frau Simone Dorn,

vielen Dank für Ihre Bestellung (Bestell-Nr. 102909497) bei esprit.de am 18.02.2013. Wir haben bisher insgesamt Zahlungen in Höhe von 39,81 EUR erhalten.

Der Rechnungsbetrag für Ihre Bestellung belief sich insgesamt auf 234,25 EUR. Bitte überweisen Sie den noch ausstehenden Betrag Ihrer Bestellung in Höhe von 194,44 EUR bis zum 20.03.2013 auf folgendes Konto:

b) remove the "%" sign

item.title: [IPL-9377] Rücküberweisungen werden an falsche Forderungen gehängt
item.description:
Hallo,
1. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=462176
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3816869
2. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=680353
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=4098611
3. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung;
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=83101
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3173279
Bitte schaut euch das mal genauer an, das sieht für mich aus wie ein Bug.
Danke und Gruß
item.summary: Rücküberweisungen werden an falsche Forderungen gehängt

comments.comment: evtl. schon einmal früher aufgetreten

weiterer Fall:

die Rücklastschrift von Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=90325

gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=2721301

weiterer Fall:

die Rücklastschirft/Rücküberweisung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=94354

gehört zur Fordeurng:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=2495321
@Maik: bei den Fällen wurden den "Rücküberweisungen" an die falsche Forderung gehängt. Das hat nichts mit "Rücklastschriften" zu tun -> Titel geändert

Weiterer Fall:
Rücküberweisung von:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=870913
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=4369614

The debts to which the customer reimbursements belong are all with TC. The actor is in all cases SYSTEM. The amounts of the reimbursements are not reasonable. We only do immediate auto reimbursement for TC when a PC event happened. This was at least for some of the affected orders not the case.

The orders to which the worng CRs are attached are all very old.

-> strange, reason is not clear for now.

First guess: the CRs don't belong to each of the debts.

Checked order_modification for 2013-01-09 09:57:07.222136 (this is where the CR for https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=462176 was created -> No events present that could lead to an immediate auto reimbursement. The time suggests that it was not a nightly auto reimbursement.

Checked debt_log around the creation time of CR entries -> same result, no reasonable events logged

Same result for subdebt_log

Load queue was not running.

weiteres Beispiel.
Die Rücküberweisung von Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=280251
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3730951

Bitte fixen

weiterer Fall:

gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=4488132

bitte fixen

bitte fixen

comments.comment: Merchant invoice after FIX

item.title: [IPL-9726] fix mt940 parser for net-m / coba files
item.description:
we now have the first file from net-m / coba to process. there are some issues with the import:

  • no logging, if no file was found / processed (e.g. due to file-name-filter), should-be: log that job was executed from backend
  • wrong local bank code (its not 9000): should-be: 131967500 (coba)
  • for DD / TC, the purpose is empty and remote bank owner is somewhat not readable - amount ends up in remote account number, etc.
    example load-q after import

11;"RC247201301310004437";"9000";"311301006302";"RC247201301310004437";"RC247201301310004437";"2013/01/31";"2013/02/04";40.31;"EUR";"Billpay";"''";"";"''" ....

you can find the example file in /data/it/Partner/net-m/mt940
item.summary: fix mt940 parser for net-m / coba files

comments.comment: @Wieslaw: can you please take a look what needs to be adjusted

Logging and bank code issues are solved For the Bank code issue, code changes still need to be committed, I will leave the commit for tomorrow to not disturb the today's release. Regarding the parse of the transactions, we have to decide what to do, the current format is not possible to parse.

i am currently finding the cause why we dont see "our purpose" when we handed in mt104. without the references, we cant match.

they will report back to me why the purpose is changed while transferring

could you return the ticket when it will be clarified
?

we clarified the "missing" VWZ, but the parser is still doing strange stuff.

example files can be found \data\it\parner\net-m\mt940

the parser does not get the remote bank data correctly

exerpt from the DB is attached ...
wrong parsing example attached - imported file: 20130205.STA

Daniel I thought you were clarifying with the bank how the format should look like.
The bank code Ridardo fixed on java side.

But the main problem was that the transaction title was not visible in the format files.

item.title: [IPL-10527] Research
item.description:
@Anca: Research necessary on:

  • which tool can we use to run automated performance/load tests (e.g. jmeter)?
  • how can this tool be integrated with our automatic regression testing system (integration with jUnit)?
  • how can result reports be made available?
  • how can acceptable thresholds be defined and evaluated?
  • how can unnormal behaviour / threshold violations be alerted using Jenkins/CI?

comments.comment: was tested by Jan T. -> works

item.title: [IPL-10568] (IPL-10079) Adjust test Configuration
item.description:
Add new maven profile to run only decision engine unit test.
All other unit test should still runt without the profile.
The parser test should run with profile name testparser.

Insert a test order.
Insert a configuration mapping of for order.
Test should return the custom ums id for this order.

Test negative case, when there is not configuration it should return
default value from interface table.

item.description:
Test over live db.

After migrating the data, and moving hardcoded mapping.
We have to check if for given merchants, the mapping works.
It will include searching order for given merchant,
and invoking the get ums id by lang for interfaced ids.
This task is not a regression test task.
It should be tested on live merchants!

item.title: [IPL-10554] (IPL-9079) Create Update Script
item.description:
Insert the old mappings existing in DB. an put them to the new table. (Should be possible with a simple script)
Drop the mapping table.

Drop old mapping table, which mapped interface type to notification type.

In this user story is not contained any configuration via Backoffice. Instead new redirects can only be added on request by the IT team.

The number of rows created in the mapping table should be the same as in notification config for custom ums id not null

item.title: [IPL-10552] (IPL-9079) Adjust ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang
item.description:
Adjust ipl_messaging.get_ums_id_by_lang that it will use the new mapping table.
Removing old mappings will be in other ticket.
If a key for a given interface type does not exist in mapping table
then use the default ums_id.

item.title: [IPL-10551] (IPL-9079) Create Mapping Table
item.description:
Create new ums mapping table, which will map directly to interface type.
with business key:
portal_id, country, currency, payment-method, customer_group, interface id
and attributes:
custom ums id

If formula condition fails we must return error code.
Rename error label for more adequad name.

Test it for each payment method.
Positive and negative case.

item.description:
extent table ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_localized (the settings are portal/country/currency dependant) with new colums "mrcl_increase_tolerance_percentage" (numeric(2,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 0.00) and "mrcl_increase_tolerance_amount" (in cents - integer NOT NULL DEFAULT 0).

Create new table for localized default configurations.

_country character varying(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'DEU'::character varying,
_currency text NOT NULL DEFAULT 'EUR'::text,
_upper_bound_deviating_shipping_address
_increase_tolerance_percentage
_increase_tolerance_amount

Insert the default configuration for all country currencies.
Note: Default values are 0% and 25Euro / XCHF (clarify with risk).

item.title: [IPL-10537] (IPL-10082) - Send files to DE server
item.description: Send files xsd and xslt to decision engine providers company

comments.comment: Files were sent. We are waiting for feedback.

item.title: [IPL-10536] (IPL-10082) - Create request and response XSLs
item.description:
Use the attached xsl and convert/adapt it to the recent data model.
Use as base the 2 files attached in the main ticket:
billpay-request.xsl
billpay-response.xsl

On eclipse you can apply transformation to xml just by right clicking on the xml and select the proper option.

Commit to SVN.

comments.comment: Was already reviewed by me and Anca and adjusted to work with existing XSD. We will leave it in review until we have some feedback from the DE Company
Missing XLS response DE specific format -> our DM format

After first validation on GUARDEAN side few changes were required:
1. change last_dunning_date typo
2. adjust the arrays generation to conform with the example they provided
3. change the namespace from ns1 to ns2
generated_working_template.xml - is the example provided by GUARDEAN which shows how the xml should look like after the xsl transformation
Reviewed by me and by SHS company. Will close when deployed

item.title: [IPL-10535] (IPL-10082) - Create XSD file for new model
item.description:
We have to manually adjust an xml schema (billpay_request_response.xsd) that defines the valid structure of the input data for the decision engine.
The file is attached in the main ticket you should convert/adapt it to the recent data model.

Input and output model are defined in the decision engine:

http://192.168.3.148:8080/guardean/
user: billpay
pwd: billpay

-> Files/Datamodel/input_model
-> Files/Datamodel/output_model

Knowledge about creation of nested complex types in XSD required.
You may need some investigation to remind or learn how to do it.
(todo: provide source).
You can do it graphically with eclipse.

Use de data model and billpay-request-response XSD as base

On eclipse you can generate a dummy xml based on your xsd created by just right click on the xsd and select the proper option.
item.summary: (IPL-10082) - Create XSD file for new model

comments.comment: Was already reviewed by me and Anca and adjusted to work with existing XSL. We will leave it in review until we have some feedback from the DE Company

REQUEST
Nested complex elements missing for:
- rating_provider
- rating_provider//list_score
- rating_provider//list_score_timestamp
- rating_provider//list_score_day_of_week
- rating_provider//list_score_distance_in_days
- rating_provider_global_settings
- payment_history_within_last_three_months//order_history//time_of_day
- payment_history_within_last_three_months//order_history//day_of_week
- payment_history_within_last_three_months//order_history//portal_id
- payment_history_within_last_three_months//order_history//order_amounts
- payment_history_within_last_twelve_months//order_history//time_of_day
- payment_history_within_last_twelve_months//order_history//day_of_week
- payment_history_within_last_twelve_months//order_history//portal_id
- payment_history_within_last_twelve_months//order_history//order_amounts
- payment_history_since_ever//order_history//time_of_day
- payment_history_since_ever//order_history//day_of_week
- payment_history_since_ever//order_history//portal_id
- payment_history_since_ever//order_history//order_amounts
- merchant_details//risk_levels_invoice
- merchant_details//risk_levels_direct_debit
- merchant_details//risk_levels_transaction_credit

RESPONSE:
- Wrong element "dataMessage" ??
- Definition of RatingProviderResultType correct? Nested element missing?
- Definition of RatingResultType correct? Nested element missing?

I think you didn't review the last version. In the current SVN version all the nested types that you mention are there. Like you can see in the attached image xsd.png and xsd2.png for the rating_provider.
Me and Anca checked every single attribute of the datamodel.
"dataMessage" is an element part of their structure, you can find it in their examples as well I kept the same logic...they can confirm.
Reviewed by Anca and confirmed by SHS company. Will close when deployed

item.title: [IPL-10337] (IPL-10074) Create a mapper for Response
item.description: Maps DE object in application object(s) to persist.

item.title: [IPL-10336] (IPL-10074) Create a mapper for Request
item.description:
Maps application object(s) in DE object.

Depending on the format of the DE object this mapper could be the same class as the other Response mapper (referenced in other task of this story). Decide when developing

item.title: [IPL-10329] (IPL-10074) Create Serialization process between XML and Java Model
item.description: The client will handle all data serialization from Java objects to XML / de-serialization from XML to Java objects.
item.summary: (IPL-10074) Create Serialization process between XML and Java Model

item.title: [IPL-10328] (IPL-10074) Create Web Service client
item.description:
Generate generic webservice client using CXF (see sample code in comment) from a WSDL file. Find out how the request struct must be created. Map generic input/output data to Java objects.

WSDL/XSD files can be found under: T:\projekte\decision engine\install\20121011_guardean_RiskSuite\services\svc_workflow\interface\wsdl

See attached document (WorkflowServiceGuide.pdf) on how to use the workflow engine web service interface.

Webservice Endpoint: http://192.168.3.148:8080/workflow/services/WorkflowEngine2

Create configuration for Live, test, dev enviroments.
To specify what urls, etc. For begining we will connect to the remote DE service.

The client will handle all data serialization from Java objects to XML / de-serialization from XML to Java objects.

Invoke the service created in other task

item.title: [IPL-10693] Deviating shipping address flag error
item.description: made a test where only billing address is supplied in the xml request. The shipping address is set but the deviating shipping address flag is TRUE. Maybe check is done when shipping address was still NULL?

item.title: [IPL-10692] OrderDetails: DayOfWeek has only 2 chars, not 3 like in specification.
item.description: orderDetails: dayOfWeek has only 2 chars, not 3 like in spec. Please check all occurences.
item.summary: OrderDetails: DayOfWeek has only 2 chars, not 3 like in specification.

item.title: [IPL-10691] Positions of Schufa/DV are often swiched (ratingProviderResults/global settings)
item.description: Positions of Schufa/DV are often swiched. DV must be rating_provider = 1 and SCHUFA must be rating_provider = 2 (e.g. in global settings and ratingProviderResults). Please check all occurences.
item.summary: Positions of Schufa/DV are often swiched (ratingProviderResults/global settings)

item.title: [IPL-10690] Rating provider results not correctly loaded for DE
item.description:
• rating provider 1 is never loaded (this probably refers to Schufa because of the swich. See bug about "Schufa/DV are often swiched. DV must be rating_provider = 1 and SCHUFA must be rating_provider = 2" it is possibly related
  • score_distance_in_days is wrong: provided must be the distance beween neighboring pairs. Right now they seem to be calculated in relation to the current date
  • DV CHE/AUT: scoreValue does not contain score. Only for DV/DEU should be provided eiether "DENIED" od "APPROVED" as scoreValue. In all other cases we need the value from cvr_validation_decision_matrix
item.summary: Rating provider results not correctly loaded for DE

item.title: [IPL-10689] DebtsInDunning::lastDunningDate is NULL when it shouldn't
item.description: debtsInDunning::lastDunningDate is NULL although a debt in dunning 1 state exists
item.summary: DebtsInDunning::lastDunningDate is NULL when it shouldn't

item.title: [IPL-10688] PaymentHistory sometimes doesn't work
item.description: paymentHistory is empty although there are fully paid orders with corresponding debt_transaction entries. Sometimes it works. Cannot be reproduced why it doesn't work sometimes. (Timestamp is not the reason)

item.title: [IPL-10142] Reverse Direct Debit Bug Transaction Credit
item.description:
I've found several very strange cases while checking our deferred payment purchase mode.
There are 60 cases from 'cancelled' which seem to have the same problem. EITHER one or two extra "returning debit notes" OR extra customer transfer. I attach the table with those cases, where I added comments to some of the them, but they seem to be the same.
so please have a look on it
item.summary: Reverse Direct Debit Bug Transaction Credit
